definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Add the sausage to a pan over medium to medium high heat.
sentences.chinese: 香腸入鍋，中火到中高火烹飪。

sentences.english: They sprinkle their cheese on top and make happy faces with their pepperoni.
sentences.chinese: 他們在表面上撒上奶酪，把香腸擺成笑臉的樣子。

sentences.english: These beetles make sausage-shaped brood chambers along the tunnels.
sentences.chinese: 這些甲蟲順着地道建造香腸形狀的產房。

sentences.english: Only the best of the wurst are served at this German imbissstand.
sentences.chinese: 在這家德國外賣店裏只出售最好的香腸。

sentences.english: They were the line foremen at the giant Wall Street sausage factory.
sentences.chinese: 他們就像華爾街“香腸工廠”的領班。

sentences.english: Cut the remaining half chorizo and bacon into slices and lay them on top.
sentences.chinese: 餘下半份香腸和煙肉切片，鋪上表面。

sentences.english: Jimmy coughed and choked on a piece of sausage.
sentences.chinese: 正喫着香腸的吉米聽到這個消息被嗆得連聲咳嗽。

sentences.english: Sausages are sizzling in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 香腸在鍋中發出滋滋聲。

sentences.english: I don't like milk, I want sausage and pan-fried bacon.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡牛奶，我想喫香腸和煎培根。

sentences.english: I found these veggie bratwursts at one of my neighborhood grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 我發現我們社區的一家雜貨店裏有素食香腸。

sentences.english: There was nothing but darkness and sausages on the menu - and schnitzel , of course.
sentences.chinese: 那裏只有黑暗，菜單上的香腸，當然還包括炸肉排。

sentences.english: Tomato sauce, mozzarella, beef tenderloin, Italian sausage.
sentences.chinese: 番茄醬，馬蘇裏拉，牛肉，意大利香腸。

sentences.english: Ill have a large cheese pizza, sausage and mushrooms.
sentences.chinese: 我想訂一個大的芝士比薩，加香腸和蘑菇。

sentences.english: “Hell, Nixon treated us better than this!” he roared—and demanded bacon, sausage, eggs and toast.
sentences.chinese: 提總是大喊着要鹹肉，香腸，蛋和麪包。
喫香腸會引發旋毛蟲病。

sentences.english: The number 5 with frankfurters and beans, please.
sentences.chinese: 來份5號餐加香腸和豆子。

definition: rice ball (steamed rice formed into a ball and stuffed with various fillings)/onigiri (Japanese-style rice ball)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
